title: Can I divert one of my Direct deposits to another account?
question: After aprox 29 yrs married I do not want to put up with any more of her indiscretions. I Have my County Retirement going into our account, aprox $2,300 a month; I also have my Disabled Veteran's pay going into our account, aprox $1,600 a month; & finally my monthly State check aprox $4,600 a month which is the one I want to divert to my own account at the Sacramento Credit Union. Our only bills are our house & my Jeep.
answers: Yes, you can do that, but only until you file or are served with divorce petition. Then, you won’t be allowed to do so. Keep fall records of transactions, it’s still CP unless you are separated.

Yes. You may direct deposits to another account.
However, spouse may petition court for instructions and order that the account be deposited into a different joint or community account.
You need attorney assistance before proceeding.
